statement from the charity commission for england and wales in response to the attack at heaton park synagogue.
charity commission chief executive, david holdsworth, has issued a statement.
updated: 2 october 2025
charity regulator appoints interim manager to newbury park masjid
the charity commission, the regulator of charities in england and wales, has appointed an interim manager to newbury park masjid (registered charity number 1118363).
updated: 30 september 2025
challenges to financial resilience among serious risks facing charities, regulator finds
risks to financial resilience are among the pressing issues facing the charity sector in 2025, according to new analysis from the charity commission.
updated: 25 september 2025
regulator to investigate islamic charity after concerns raised over its financial controls
the charity commission is escalating its engagement with the hussaini charitable trust to a statutory inquiry over ongoing concerns about the charity’s reporting of its finances.
updated: 17 september 2025
two board members appointed to the charity commission for england and wales.
the secretary of state has reappointed ann phillips and pippa britton obe as board members to the charity commission for a second term.
updated: 17 september 2025
charity commission ceo david holdsworth visits south wales charities
welsh charity makes use of funds through the regulator’s revitalising trusts programme.
updated: 4 september 2025
regulator launches investigation into foodbank over concerns the charity cannot account for its use of funds
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry to assess concerns about knowsley foodbank.
updated: 3 september 2025
regulator opens next phase of investigation into 105 charities connected to company cashing cheques
the charity commission has announced the next 10 charities entering a class inquiry it opened in may 2025.
updated: 1 september 2025
regulator to investigate sikh charities after failure to comply with orders
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry into two charities connected to the guru nanak gurdwara, wednesfield, which were set up for the advancement of the sikh religion in the area.
updated: 28 august 2025
charity commission disqualifies four trustees after ceo used charity as front for criminal activities
the charity commission, the regulator of charities in england and wales, has concluded its inquiry into organisation of blind africans & caribbeans (obac), finding four trustees responsible for serious failings.
updated: 28 august 2025
investigation opened into heritage charity over serious dispute
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry into the brighton and hove heritage commission.
updated: 21 august 2025
investigation opened into charity over trustees’ failure to resolve land dispute
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry into darul-uloom school london.
updated: 20 august 2025
regulator investigates supported housing charity over financial concerns
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry into emerge.
updated: 15 august 2025
regulator to investigate christian charity after almost £300k appears unaccounted for
the charity commission has launched a statutory inquiry into edmund kell unitarian church and elizabeth kell community hall over financial and safeguarding concerns.
updated: 7 august 2025
regulator concludes case into sentebale
the charity commission has concluded its compliance case into sentebale, a charity which works with children and young people in southern africa.
updated: 6 august 2025
investigation opened into charity over potentially inflammatory sermon and social media
the charity commission has opened a statutory inquiry into the abdullah quilliam society.

football clubs partner with government to help young people into work
thousands more young people are to receive life-changing support into work or training – with football clubs across the country signing up to help the government in their mission to ensure every 18-to-21-year-old has the cha…
updated: 24 september 2025
£45 million saved for pension schemes thanks to government reforms
the pension protection fund has today (23rd september) confirmed that it will not charge a levy to pension providers, saving £45 million across 5,000 defined benefit (db) pension schemes.
updated: 23 september 2025
ramped up job support for people on sickness benefits
specialist jobcentre staff redeployed to give skills and employment support to tens of thousands of people with no requirement to look for work.
updated: 22 september 2025
dr stephen brien reappointed chair of the social security advisory committee
the department for work and pensions announced that dr stephen brien has been reappointed as chair of the social security advisory committee (ssac).
updated: 15 september 2025
thousands of sick and disabled people to get life-changing support into work
thousands of sick or disabled people will be helped into good, secure jobs following a major expansion of tailored employment support announced by the department for work and pensions today [thursday 04 september]
updated: 4 september 2025
disability rights expert zara todd appointed to lead new panel shaping government’s health and disability policy
equity and inclusion consultant zara todd has been appointed as chair of the government's new independent disability advisory panel, taking a guiding role in its development and focus.
updated: 21 august 2025
thousands more young people to get training and work support as government extends £45 million scheme
thousands more young people will receive tailored support to help them into a fulfilling career thanks to a £45 million extension to the youth guarantee trailblazer scheme.
updated: 21 august 2025
millions to receive essential benefit payments ahead of august bank holiday
millions of people will receive their essential financial support before the august bank holiday weekend, as the government has confirmed that benefit payments will be brought forward to friday 22 august.
updated: 19 august 2025
miscarriages of justice victims given access to vital support
victims of miscarriages of justice will no longer lose out on key benefit support, thanks to legislative changes coming into force today [tuesday 22 july].
updated: 22 july 2025
government revives landmark pensions commission to confront retirement crisis that risks tomorrow’s pensioners being poorer than today’s
millions of people could benefit from a more secure retirement as the government today [monday 21 july 2025] revives the landmark pensions commission to examine why tomorrow’s pensioners are on track to be poorer than today’…
updated: 21 july 2025
secretary of state for work and pensions speech on reviving the landmark pensions commission
the secretary of state for work and pensions the rt hon liz kendall mp delivered the below speech on the 21 july 2025.
updated: 21 july 2025
immediate support for returning british families fleeing crisis
new emergency rules will exempt british nationals and their family members from a residence test when fleeing major international crises
updated: 17 july 2025
government launches "good food cycle" to transform britain's food system 
new "good food cycle" framework serves up healthier eating, stronger food security and greener supply chains  
updated: 15 july 2025
new panel of young people to shape the government’s youth guarantee
young people with experience of being out of education, employment and training will help shape policy as part of a new youth guarantee advisory panel.
updated: 11 july 2025
£100 million cash boost to help thousands into work across the country
thousands of disabled people and people with complex health conditions to receive help finding secure, well-paid jobs
updated: 11 july 2025
boost for gp practices to help people back to work
a new pilot programme will support people with health conditions back into employment and ease pressure on doctors.
updated: 11 july 2025
millions of households to be given income boost as bill progresses through parliament
nearly 4 million households will see an annual income boost estimated to be worth £725 cash as a bill to overhaul the welfare system completes the next stage of its passage through parliament.
updated: 9 july 2025
workers in line for £29,000 boost thanks to landmark pensions bill
the bill is set to transform the pensions landscape for years to come and put more money in people’s pockets as part of the plan for change
updated: 7 july 2025
further details on welfare reforms published ahead of second reading
new details on the government’s welfare reforms will be published today (monday 30 june 2025) ahead of second reading of the universal credit and personal independence payment bill on tuesday.

ilf launches its publication ‘twenty-seven’
over the past 27 years the independent living fund (ilf) has provided support to over 46,000 disabled people.
updated: 4 june 2015
care and support arrangements for ilf recipients in northern ireland
payments to independent living fund (ilf) recipients in northern ireland will be administered through the newly created ilf scotland.
updated: 26 may 2015
independent living fund reappointment of chair and vice chair of board of trustees
stephen jack obe and professor peter cooke reappointed as chair and vice chair of the independent living fund board of trustees.
updated: 24 march 2015

care and support arrangements for ilf recipients in wales
the welsh government will transfer support for independent living fund (ilf) recipients in wales to local authorities from 1 july 2015.
updated: 17 march 2015
independent living fund reappoint michael boyall as a member of the board of trustees
michael boyall has been reappointed as a member of the board of trustees of the independent living fund.
updated: 30 january 2015

the high court upholds the government's decision to close the independent living fund
the high court has announced its decision on the judicial review case between 2 ilf users and the secretary of state for work and pensions.
updated: 9 december 2014
northern ireland launches consultation on future support for ilf users
the department of health, social services and public safety (dhssps) in northern ireland has launched a consultation for views on how current users of the ilf in northern ireland can be supported from 1 july 2015.
updated: 12 august 2014
england code of practice relaunched
relaunch of the code of practice to enhance the effective delivery of the closure programme to support working between the ilf and local authorities in england.
updated: 28 april 2014
scottish government’s decision on a scottish independent living fund
the scottish government has announced it will establish a scottish independent living fund to protect the funding of existing users in scotland.
updated: 16 april 2014

updated: 20 february 2024
vital marine ecosystems in an additional 4,000 square km of our seas to receive protection
marine management organisation (mmo) byelaw to protect valuable marine habitats and species in a further 13 english offshore marine protected areas (mpas) will come into force on 22 march 2024.
updated: 1 february 2024
“get prepared… install your i-vms device now!” urges mmo
marine management organisation (mmo) has confirmed that more than 80% of under-12m inshore vessels participated in the i-vms roll-out programme last year, resulting in £1.3m of european funding being awarded to fishers.
updated: 18 january 2024
catch recording changes
changes to a key section of the catch recording app and website are being planned to enable fishermen to record when retained catch is landed.
updated: 22 december 2023
announcement of crawfish fishery closures in 2024
building on recent announcements relating to the move to a harmonised mcrs for crawfish and publication of the crab and lobster fmp, marine management organisation (mmo) can now confirm the decision on the proposal to close english waters ices area 7 for fishing crawfish.
updated: 21 december 2023
opportunity to manage inshore fisheries and conservation
the mmo have been given responsibility by defra to manage the process of making appointments of general members to ifca committees.
updated: 21 december 2023
18 december deadline for i-vms roll-out to under-12m
marine management organisation (mmo) is reminding fishers with under-12m vessels that are yet to purchase their inshore vessel monitoring system (i-vms) device, or have done so but are yet to claim their grant funding, that they have until 18 december 2023 to do so.
updated: 8 december 2023

updated: 7 december 2023

the studland bay marine partnership has been awarded £186,000 from the marine management organisation’s fisheries and seafood scheme to support the conservation of studland bay’s precious marine ecosystems.…
updated: 28 november 2023
new measures announced to protect crawfish stocks in the southwest
marine management organisation (mmo) is to increase the minimum conservation reference size (mcrs) for crawfish (palinurus spp) in ices area 7 from 95 mm to 110 mm from 1 january 2024.
updated: 13 november 2023
exploring and celebrating studland bay’s environment
mmo is holding a community workshop bringing together people who live, work and visit studland bay to share knowledge, experiences and values associated with the bay and its vitally important natural environment.
updated: 31 october 2023
local partnership and mmo join forces to preserve studland bay’s precious seagrass habitats
throughout 2023, the marine management organisation and studland bay marine partnership (sbmp) have continued to take forward initiatives to protect studland bay’s precious marine ecosystems.…
updated: 27 october 2023
mmo commences i-vms roll-out phase for under six metre vessels
mmo is now commencing the roll-out phase of inshore vessel monitoring system (i-vms) devices to under six metre vessels. this phase continues the mmo’s support for all under 12 metre vessels to enable them to meet the requir…
updated: 25 october 2023
i-vms roll-out enters final phase
as the roll-out schedule for ordering inshore vessel monitoring system (i-vms) devices enters its third and final phase, fishers with 6-12m vessels are reminded to take advantage of the grant funding by 30 november.
updated: 19 october 2023
tyne bridge restoration must avoid shining lights at the river
as work starts on the tyne bridge restoration, specific assurances were required to gain the requisite licensing from the mmo.
updated: 11 october 2023
act now - just nine weeks left to claim i-vms grant
fishers with under-12m vessels are being urged to act now to ensure they don’t lose out on grant funding for an i-vms device ahead of the legal requirements coming into force next spring.
updated: 28 september 2023
changes to burials at sea requirements for the needles site

new measures announced to protect crawfish stocks in the southwest
marine management organisation (mmo) is to increase the minimum conservation reference size (mcrs) for crawfish (palinurus spp) in ices area 7 from 95 mm to 110 mm from 1 january 2024.
updated: 13 november 2023

mmo is holding a community workshop bringing together people who live, work and visit studland bay to share knowledge, experiences and values associated with the bay and its vitally important natural environment.
updated: 31 october 2023

updated: 25 october 2023
i-vms roll-out enters final phase
as the roll-out schedule for ordering inshore vessel monitoring system (i-vms) devices enters its third and final phase, fishers with 6-12m vessels are reminded to take advantage of the grant funding by 30 november.

as work starts on the tyne bridge restoration, specific assurances were required to gain the requisite licensing from the mmo.

the review into police use of force and police driving investigations has commenced.
